website_summaries.verdict: For occasional car camping and outdoor activities, this chair provides sturdy, sag-free seating and a comfortable pitch angle, but may not hold up to more rigorous or frequent use.
pros: Built-in carrying strap and dual-lock feature (chair locks open, and locks close, too) are a big plus for many owners
Seat doesn’t sag, making it easy to sit down and get up
Back angle is comfortable and seat height and depth are just right for most users
cons: A bit heavy to carry and slightly taller than other quad chairs
Seat height may be too high for shorter users
Reports of rivets breaking or fabric ripping after just a few uses
Doesn’t hold up to heavy-duty, frequent use

customer_reviews.title: 2 X the Cost but 10X the Comfort
customer_reviews.text: The Kijaro chair is much more sturdy and comfortable than the cheap $10 generic chairs sold at the big box stores. Here I show my green Kijaro side by side with a blue cheapo I also own. The Kijaro sits higher, the seat is flat and more rigid and the back angle does not pitch you forward. You don't feel like you are sitting in a bucket. The price seems to vary based on the color. If you're not picky, check all the colors, get the bargain and save 10 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 3 of these chairs (all different colors) - ALL of them have broken! One of them broke in the first week. They are comfortable, but absolute garbage! The screws pop off the back making the crossbars come apart. Our next door neighbors: same chairs, same problems. None of us are overweight. My neighbors did have one of the extra large, it too broke. Don't buy these. You'll just be on Amazon searching for new chairs like me.
customer_reviews.author: MamaMeier

customer_reviews.title: It's very sturdy. The quality of the material is superior to ...
customer_reviews.text: I shopped around for a long time before deciding on this chair. It's very sturdy. The quality of the material is superior to all the other chairs I have seen. The hanging pouch is a little small and tight, but zips up. When camping I have too much stuff to keep track of, phone, drink, keys, etc. This keeps all the stuff in one place. It is heavier, but quality items usual weigh more.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This chair broke after one day of use. A rivet holding the back bracing bar snapped.
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: I love the fact that the seat doesn't sag
customer_reviews.text: Well I must say, I started out loving these chairs. We bought two of them. I love the fact that the seat doesn't sag. The frames are also nice and sturdy, the carrying case is a nice bonus. I was even tempted to purchase 2 more but today I discovered after only just a little over two months the fabric on one of the chairs is already torn by the poles at the top of the seat backs. I’ve had the cheap chairs last longer than two months. It’s past the date to return them, so I guess I’m SOL. Sorry, if your looking for longevity, I don’t think these chairs will last a season.
customer_reviews.author: LAT

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to love this chair
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this chair. I did several searches on the internet to find the best camping chair, and this was what I found. I like the design, and the chair is comfortable. However, for the price, the quality just isn't that great. After only a few uses (using the chair just in my backyard, no rugged landscape), two bolts came out of the chair, rendering the chair useless. My husband (whom I bought this as a gift for) was able to make a temporary fix but it took time and effort, when for the price nothing should have come apart in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: CE

customer_reviews.title: Broke after moderate use
customer_reviews.text: We initially thought these were the best chairs since sliced bread. They seemed sturdy and you didn't sink down into them, supporting your body better. After almost a year of moderate use (use 2-4 times per week for soccer and track practices/games), three of the four chairs that we bought have had problems with the hardware that connect the cross bars to the main supports. We've tried different nuts/bolts to put in to make them work, but they just don't seem to work. So disappointing. Edited to add: I contacted Kijaro directly and they replaced the chairs very quickly. I didn't have to send them the old ones...they just asked where the fail points were located on the chairs.
customer_reviews.author: C. LaRue

customer_reviews.title: I love this chair
customer_reviews.text: I love this chair! I was sick of buy the cheap $10 bag chairs that always broke. Spent some extra money on this nicer one and it is well worth it. Larger seat for wider people and very sturdy. It locks open so you don’t have to worry about sitting on it funny and folding back together. It is a little heavier than the standard bag chair but comes with a bag to carry and also the chair itself has a carry strap.
customer_reviews.author: kss17

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: These are so heavy, difficult to open, and huge. You could fit two people into one chair, and i can't get it open or closed - my husband has to do it. They're so heavy to carry, you would never want to carry them anywhere. And, when i tried to return it, the company says i have to pay for shipping $25, plus pay a 20% restocking fee. So, they are basically not accepting the return, because it would cost me as much to return it as i paid for it. Into the trash these chairs go! Do not buy these unless you're looking for an enormous and heavy camping chair that you cannot return!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: Great price and quality
customer_reviews.text: I love the firm seat and back support of these camping chairs. We ordered this normal size in pink and feel like the size is quite a good large size for a chair. Larger than a typical outdoor camping chair which is nice. We also ordered the XL large size and felt like the normal size was large enough. Also the XL large was only slightly larger. That being said this chair is well worth the price. The only con is that when folded and stored in its bad it still takes up quite a bit of space. It would need an adult to carry due to its size but it is not overly heavy
customer_reviews.author: Shiao-En Lee

customer_reviews.title: Darn it - The chair broke
customer_reviews.text: I love this chair so comfy and pretty. I was excited to be able to take and sit in it at our weekend camping/racing trips. On the 4th time we used it, the legs shirred off at the cross leg rivet. I had read other reviews like this but figured the chairs must getting a beating. Alas, I was so gentle with it and shifted while sitting in the chair, it pitched me out. The rivet area is damaged beyond fixing. How utterly disappointing and I have 2 more months of adventures with no purple folding chair.
customer_reviews.author: MiMiMarie

customer_reviews.title: A really great durable well made chair
customer_reviews.text: We bought one of these at Camping World. It is very well made and sturdy. It is also built on a larger scale so it is more comfortable and doesn't tip. We camp a lot and I was tired of throwing out cheap chairs that the frame would break, the fabric would tear or the chair would fold up or tip. This chair will last a long time. We liked it enough to order more on Amazon which carries all the colors. Thank you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Strauch

customer_reviews.title: Broke in one month
customer_reviews.text: Terrible chair. We had it for one month but only used it 3 or 4 times and it’s already broken. My daughter definitely doesn’t exceed the weight limit. It’s just a bad product
customer_reviews.author: LEW

customer_reviews.title: Easy to replace with sturdier bolt from local hardware but ...
customer_reviews.text: Same problem as others with bolt shearing on first use. Easy to replace with sturdier bolt from local hardware but shouldn't have to. Does have flat more comfortable bottom without sag. Seat height may be too high for some. I'm about 5' 10" and seat height good for me. I'm guessing about 5' 8" might be the limit though. However the no sag might be of more value vs the seat height for smaller stature people. If not for the sheared bolt, I'd give 5 stars on comfort and quality for people tall enough to handle the higher seat height. And as others mention, it does require more room in the back of your car SUV for transport.
customer_reviews.author: 5wood

customer_reviews.title: Only camping chair I’ll buy
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE these chairs. My husband and I each got one about three years ago and they have held up beautifully. This year my oldest daughter has outgrown her kiddie camping chair and we knew we needed to get her one of these. We got her the teal one and it is great. I love these because of the locking feature. We go camping each year with our kids and nieces and nephews- with younger kids around, it’s important to us that our chairs don’t tip over. These are super sturdy. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: cubsfan42085

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but HEAVY
customer_reviews.text: High-quality sturdy chair. Has important features I wanted such as dual cupholders including a larger cupholder that will fit a 30 ounce Tumblr. Chair locks when both folded and fully opened, must push a button on the side to open and fold back up. Has a carrying strap which is nice for when the bag falls apart as they typically do. The one thing to know is it’s extremely heavy, almost 10 pounds. This was fully disclosed in the product info I just didn’t realize how much heavier this was than my other chairs. Makes it difficult if carrying multiple chairs, backpacks, etc for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: km12

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping, but not for the beach
customer_reviews.text: We do love the comfort of these chairs. Nice big seat with perfectly angled back. Relatively light for its weight limit, and super cool since there's not any padding. However, use these chairs more than twice at the beach and you'll never be able to open them again. The sand and these joints just don't seem to agree. So it depends on your use case: camping or yard? This is a great chair! But if you're like us and want a good beach chair, this is not the chair you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: GodfreyD

customer_reviews.title: The seat is not as comfortable as we were hoping (very flat and stiff) and ...
customer_reviews.text: These are just OK. They came in separate ginormous boxes - I was shocked at how big they were. Before opening, I worried that we ordered chairs that didn't fold down into a carrying bag by mistake. The seat is not as comfortable as we were hoping (very flat and stiff) and the back is not high enough to support you head given the slant of the back that would be nice. We do like the slight lean back angle of the seat, but overall, nothing special. We're keeping them, because we needed to replace our broken seats, but I recommend sitting in them somewhere (if at all possible) before ordering them from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: S. Holness

customer_reviews.title: Good quality; way too big/heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Big and heavy. Bought two, based on good ratings, looks, and locking mechanism--one for my wife and one for me. Took it to an outdoor concert; after a short walk I had to carry both, since it was too heavy/ cumbersome for my wife. And, folded up/packaged in bag, these things are long. I mean huge. I felt a little stupid lugging them around. They are comfortable, though. Not sure if the locking mechanism him is necessary at all. It really just seems to complicate the set up/breakdown process. For the price One of these, I could/should have bought a couple of cheaper versions it would've been absolutely fine.
customer_reviews.author: Scoop

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last over time
customer_reviews.text: Warning: this chair does not hold up over time. I have had this chair 3 years. It is used primarily for summer camping trips; therefore it gets light occasional use, only a few times a year. I was on a camping trip this past weekend and the chair was growing increasingly uncomfortable. I investigated and found my chair was broken in two places; a rivet and a bolt were missing from different places. See pics. The chair was otherwise in great shape. I expect a camp chair that gets minimal use to last several years. The warranty on this chair is 1 year, so it is out of warranty and I’ll need to purchase a new chair. I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cinnamon toast girl

customer_reviews.title: Best camp chair ever
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love these chairs. Have owned this brand for several years until someone stole them from our storage area. We didn't even look at any other brands, when purchasing new ones, because we were so happy with these. The color looks teal in the picture, but it is more dark green.....however, at times it looks teal. I like it either way.
customer_reviews.author: drynard

customer_reviews.title: Great, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Overall this might be the best chair I've had, especially for the price. PROs: flat seat, sturdy, arms stay put in a good place, locking mechanism and carry strap, 2 cup holders, usable side bag CONs: rivets are already rusting in only 2 months, poor lumbar support (a small pillow helps a lot), large cup holder is a bit tight on a Nalgene bottle (scrapes on the design or stickers), feet are kinda small and sink in too easily in loose gravel or soft soil
customer_reviews.author: C. Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful but heavy
customer_reviews.text: Very roomy seat, that is angled up under the knee area. So the backrest is also slightly reclined, not straight up. I’m 5’4, husband’s 6’1, and we both think this chair is very comfortable. It is easy to get up out of. 2 Cupholders! ~ each a different size. 2 accessory pouches! Very well made/good quality. Locking mechanism is very helpful. It’s a beautiful Yellow great folding chair. Only CON is that it is heavy, and large when folded. So, not great if you need to carry it far or have space or weight limits. It’s very well made. If you need a roomy or strong chair to sit in, and don’t need to carry it far, it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent chair
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are better than any other camping chair I’ve had before. They are also less expensive. I didn’t buy them for the locking feature, but it’s nice because the chair won’t collapse on itself when open (think children), and it locks the chair when folded so it doesn’t try to open when you are putting it away or while in storage. These chairs are very comfortable and durable. They also come with cup holders on both sides, a carrying strap built in to the back of the chair, and a small side pocket to stash stuff in while sitting. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Spathelf

customer_reviews.title: Must be fairly tall to use
customer_reviews.text: If you look at the picture with the three models hanging out you'll notice that the woman's feet aren't able to actually rest on the ground. I'm 5'6 and circulation to my lower legs gets cut off hanging over the edge of this thing. It's also reclined at enough of an angle that you have to actively support your head. Finally, the arms rests can't go any lower which means that unless you're tall enough to use them as-is you're going to be forced to constantly have your arms extended or just not use the arm rests at all. I'll have to find a reallly tall friend to give this to since the return shipping costs aren't really worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Fern

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy camping chair
customer_reviews.text: This chair is solid and worth every extra penny you pay for it. You can buy a $20 folding chair anywhere but it wont be as rigid and supportive nor will it last as long. This chair isn't as light as your average Walmart chair but it makes up for that with sturdiness. There is a switch that keeps the chair from unfolding when traveling and folding when being used. The fabric gets really tight like a director's chair. Two cup holders and a phone pouch provide more than enough storage space. Best chair I ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Zachery Phillip Prescott

customer_reviews.title: Buy this chair to prevent SCHLUMP!
customer_reviews.text: This is a comfortable chair. I like that it doesn't fold in on you when you sit in it. I have many of these bag chairs, and they are ALL uncomfortable, when you sit down they squeeze in on your and you're sitting in a SChLump! Who can sit like that for minutes let alone an hour? A friend of mine had one of these at the last concert in the park and once I tried it I was sold. I ordered one on the spot, with the convenient Amazon app. We are the have it now generation and we shall
customer_reviews.author: Mik E Mouse

customer_reviews.title: OK, longer than most in closed position and very expensive to return
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the chair is ok - has 2 cup holders which is nice. It clicks into open position and will click into closed position. I was disappointed that the chair was very long in the closed position, much longer than 3 other similar chairs we've had. It won't fit in the back of the SUV unless it's diagonal or some other weird position. When looking to return it, it cost more than 50% of the product price to return it.... making it a total waste of money to return.
customer_reviews.author: M. Zarzycki

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, sturdy, very well priced.
customer_reviews.text: These chair are a GREAT deal for the money. Heavier than the cheapos, but I consider that a good thing. Locking mechanism works perfectly, they fold easily, and quite comfortable to sit in! With all of the talk around 'back support' on the chairs I had expected a more stiff/rigid/potentially uncomfortable seat (since I tend to slouch a bit), but these chairs hit a perfect Goldilocks mix of firmness vs. give. Will happily be bringing these on all of my future camping trips. And the quality seems like they could last for 3+ years of solid use. If you are considering anything in the $30-$50 price point, I strongly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: pschneider

customer_reviews.title: Best camping chairs! We own 3
customer_reviews.text: These are the best chairs we own... No kidding we use this as a chair in our kitchen! I use it for nursing because it's huge, holds water in the two cup holders, and is super comfortable. We have three of these, different colors... All the colors have been true to the picture. My husband and his dad are 6'5", over 200lbs and have a hard time during in normal camping chairs, not to mention they are not comfortable or sturdy. These chairs are perfect for those guys & even great for me, 5"3'... They are awesome... And what a bargin too!
customer_reviews.author: N. Schumann

customer_reviews.title: Nice support, good quality, but heavy
customer_reviews.text: This chair is over 9 lbs and is much heavier than the ones you'll find in your average big box or sporting goods store. It's also much longer than the average chair, I have to store it an angle in my sedan's trunk. There's a strap connected directly to the chair so you can forgo the storage bag if you want. The no sag middle is true providing much more comfortable support. I like that there are cup holders on both arms. When the chair is folded it locks into place, however it does not lock in the most closed position, more like a 2 inches wider than fully closed.
customer_reviews.author: Thuong Pham

customer_reviews.text: Freakin love this thing. My best friend got one from her mom for her birthday, her husband and I liked it so much that we ended up getting our own. I didn't check the official name colors, but I have the dark turquoise one, my best friend has the hot pink/fuchsia one, and her husband has lime green. All the colors are vibrant and as pictured. I usually sit with my feet up in my seat, so when I don't want my 25lb dog in my lap I love that the chair is still roomy enough for him to fit beside me.
customer_reviews.author: Rei

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair because the first camp chair I purchased was a $10 piece of junk. It cut into the underside of my legs and hurt like crazy. This cheer got great reviews on Amazon and it's easy to see why, high build quality, very nice materials, great finish. It's built like a tank and should last for a long time. I'm very happy with this purchase and recommend it without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: Precision Works Mechanical Electrical

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic camping chairs. My wife and I are smokers, but never in the house. (Meh, it is what it is) We wanted some comfy chairs for out little smoking area... And these are the bomb. Super-comfy. Like, better than my couch comfy. They're made well, sit you at a nice height, and have a generous seat that doesn't sag. Both the Wife and I are thrilled. We have had some other brands in the past, but these blew them away. Truly fantastic chairs. Also, I got mine in purple... And it's a VERY nice color of purple. If you're a ravens or Vikings fan, these will look great at your tailgate.
customer_reviews.author: Jason E. Maggard

customer_reviews.title: Very roomy and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. They are very sturdy. They open and close easily - if you use the button to unlock them. There are carry straps on the chair itself and on the sturdy protective bag. there are drink holders in each arm. One for a drink, one for bug spray. :-) The accessory bag is small not sure what you'd put in there, maybe a phone. We have a compact car and they do take up a lot of room in the car and they feel heavier to carry than the 9.5 pounds that are claimed. I didn't weigh them, though.
customer_reviews.author: Falmouth

customer_reviews.title: If you’re looking for quality, modest price, & color is important? Look no more!
customer_reviews.text: Set it up in living room, my wife liked it so much, I ordered her one as well! I read the reviews. Some complain about loose bolts. So I got out metric tools & Phillips screw driver, not counting riveted ones there’s total of 4 bolts, two were tight, one was loose and I tightened all, no problem!
customer_reviews.author: gene d friberg

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra money than cheaper versions
customer_reviews.text: You won't regret spending a bit more for a chair like this. I've always purchased coleman camp chairs or the like from Walmart. One of my friends had this chair at our kids' soccer practice and highly recommended it. I'm so glad we bought two! They're large and fit a variety of body shapes from a 5 year old to a larger 60-year-old man, they're well made, and they are comfortable. I love the cup holders as well. We also take these to air shows. I wish I would've bought them sooner.
customer_reviews.author: J. Maclauchlan

customer_reviews.title: Best camping chair ever
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this the best camping chair i've ever used, it's one of the most well made and engineered products I've ever owned. Setting it up is super easy - unlike every other camping chair I've used it just folds out and back up naturally and smoothly. It's big, solid, and titled at just the right angle so you're still sitting upright but not ramrod straight. I would have no problem using this as a desk chair to work at, and it's been great for reading and even meditating. The strap on the carrying bag isn't fantastic but I imagine you could always rig something up to make it more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: dv321

customer_reviews.title: COMFY Chairs
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with the chair! My previous 'bag' chairs seem to have gotten smaller (or I may have gotten bigger) and less comfortable. These are spacious and comfortable and supportive! Very happy with the chairs! Was pleasantly surprised that there is one normal sized cup holder and the other one is a little bigger so it's versatile! One negative thing I noticed when my kids sat on them they sat on the front edge at first and they tip forward a little because they're bigger. They are not designed for kids, but is something to be aware of!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hays

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous chair
customer_reviews.text: The chair is very sturdy and I love that the seat is taut and does not sag or slump...it is also sits a bit taller than my other chair. It comes with a very nice tote bag of the same weight fabric the chair is made of...I won't be using that bag until I store the chair for the winter...I wish I had this chair at the beginning of the Pandemic for my trips to the park. No more struggling to get my camp chair out of the tote bag and no more sore back from sitting in a slumped position.
customer_reviews.author: galleylama

customer_reviews.title: Stoutly built and constructed for us taller humans!
customer_reviews.text: STOUTLY built. LOVE that it locks open. The seat does not sag down like most camp chairs, and offers a taller back for us taller folks. It also sits higher odd the ground and has more substantial "feet," on them, which keeps you from "sinking" into the ground. Down side...it's NOT super light...so if you are a tiny person...might want to consider the weight factor...but it's NOT an issue for me at all. Colors are vibrant too, which is also a plus! 2 cup holders which is awesome...one for my drink...one for my phone! ;)
customer_reviews.author: Michelle P. Hardesty

customer_reviews.title: Pretty pink, more comfortable than most folding chairs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the beach and for ballgames. It's more comfortable than most folding chairs and doesn't press against the back of my legs like most of them do. I have sciatica, so that's a huge factor when choosing a folding chair. The pouch on the side for a cell phone and keys is pretty skimpy compared to the one on my hubby's $29 Coleman chair. I couldn't fit my Kindle in it. The pink color is nice. It's a little tricky to open the first time because of the lock, but easy enough once you know to look for it.
customer_reviews.author: Petunia

customer_reviews.title: I don’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: This chair broke the 3rd time I used it at the same back support it broke for some of the other reviewers. Very upset for the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Quality
customer_reviews.text: My husband was very annoyed and skeptical when I ordered him this chair. We are at sporting events for our kids every weekend so we get a lot of use out of camping chairs and we go through them quickly. My husband is 6’3” and 230lbs so he says most chairs are “Mickey Mouse” for him. He LOVES this chair! It is SO much sturdier and more comfortable than any other chair we’ve had. It comes with a case that he refuses to use because the strap that comes attached to the chair is good enough for him. I’m going to have to order another because I prefer this one to my Kelsyus Umbrella chair hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Jess I.

customer_reviews.title: Solid purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Love these chairs. I bought 4 after discovering them a benefit cigar herf for Wings for Warriors when someone showed up with a couple. They are solid, comfortable and easily accommodate my 5'10, 230 lb fat body (don't judge, I'm working on it, folks). They lock open and closed, have a nice carry sheath with a nylon strap, two cup holders and a zipper pouch that you can fit the folded sheath into or stash other items so you don't lose them.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo DeBlasio

customer_reviews.title: Very Large Chairs!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Very well built. - Very sturdy. - Very stable. - Comfortable as far as folding chairs go. Cons: - Very large. 4' long and 8" around when folded. For our purposes, they would be 4 stars or maybe even 3 1/2 because we expected a compact chair. That said, they are not listed as a compact folding chair, so I'm considering this my error. No stars deducted. - The drink holders do not appear to be of the same strength as the rest of the chair. I suspect these will fail long before the rest of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and sturdy chairs!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve taken my chairs (I have 2) camping and to the beach. These things are the best. Very comfy, it doesn’t slouch at lower back. They are easy to fold and open. Only downside is that they are heavier and bigger than other chairs, but hey I’ll take it! The Amazon basics chair is about $40. Might as well buy yourself something that’s worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Chelly

customer_reviews.title: Lost piece of chair in 1st week
customer_reviews.text: Love the chair however within the 1st week we had it (using it maybe a total of an hour) we noticed it was missing the silver piece that holds the upper left side of the back of the chair together. My Husband had to fasten something to hold the chair together. Was going to order my Husband this chair in blue and now going to go with someone else I think. 1st photo is side we fixed. Second photo is piece that went missing.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair
customer_reviews.text: My adult children have had this same chair for over a year and I always liked them better than my "big and tall" chair so when it became time to get a new camp chair I ordered this one. They also make a "big and tall" model but it is longer and heavier. I'm 6'5" and weigh just under 300 lbs. The fits well and is comfortable. The locking mechanism that keeps the chair both open and closed is a grate feature. I also like that the carrying sleve is large enough to easily slide in the chair without extra effort.
customer_reviews.author: Computer Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great construction, good price point
customer_reviews.text: Best camp chair I've ever had, historically I've gotten the cheapest chairs that fall apart, but decided to get something quality this time. Love the turquoise color! The cup holder and hanging organizational pouch are good sizes. The locking mechanism allows you to carry the chair without the bag and also locks the chair in place so your not pushed forward while sitting. By far the best chair I've ever owned, my husband purchased one for himself too.
customer_reviews.author: Adventure Lady

customer_reviews.title: Well made and well priced camp chair!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it much, yet, but wanted an above-average quality chair for an upcoming season of doing Shakespeare in the Park. A bit heavier than most, but TOTALLY worth the extra weight, methinks. Flatter seat is GREAT, above-average weight capacity, sturdy joints- I love it! While the carry bag is a little imperfectly balanced, I was pleased to note there was enough extra space in it to hold and umbrella and umbrella clamp. Nice color choices, too!
customer_reviews.author: Mary B in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Best folding chair.
customer_reviews.text: This chair is sturdy and does not sag. The first 2 I bought 3 years ago are still working. He lock can get tricky after a while of use but I deal with it. A little jiggling when closing the chair does the trick. Most importantly they do not sag and the fabric has held up extremely well. I use these for soccer and camping. Sometimes I leave them out in the rain and they are still in good shape. This is my second purchase because I love this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Larger than expected but very sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy, comfortable chair. It is much more comfortable than the low cost chairs you might find in a discount store where you sink into the seat and it feels like it is folding up as you sit in it. Once opened, the chair locks in place. The seat bottom is taught and the arms are flat. There are drink holders on both arms and a pouch for keys and phone. For all that, you get a slightly longer and heavier chair. It comes with a carrying bag and a carrying strap right on the chair. I am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jcvamazon

customer_reviews.title: Best Beach chair ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the third chair I've bought from this company. They are the best chairs I've had, sturdy construction, easy to set up and take down, very comfortable to sit in for long periods of time at the beach. Could not be more happy with these purchases.
customer_reviews.author: big steve

customer_reviews.title: Keep this Chair Out of the Sun!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and sturdy chair. I bought two of them in 2016. The seat went out on the red one in 2018, and in the blue one in 2019. I'm not a heavy guy. I strongly suspect the fabric failed owing to UV exposure, and perhaps the red (and lesser-used) chair failed sooner because of its color. Scientists may want to weight in on this. Either fold up your chair and not leave it out in the sun/weather or cover it after use. I probably wouldn't buy another one, however.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Lindquist

customer_reviews.title: Great chair
customer_reviews.text: Love this chair. It feels strong. I like how the chair clicks into place when put down but also when you collapse it to allow for easy carrying even if you aren’t using the bag it came in. Wider sitting area than most because it sets tighter than other chairs allow for the feeling of more space. Also like that the bag it comes in is sturdier than most chairs which leaves me hopeful that it may last longer.
customer_reviews.author: lah602

customer_reviews.title: An exceptional product!
customer_reviews.text: This is an exceptional folding camp style chair. I took it on a 20,000 mile road trip all over the country, and they got a lot of use. It’s the most comfortable folding chair that I’ve ever sat in, and it is very well constructed, of excellent materials. You need to press a lock button to fold and unfold it, which can be confusing to new users, but the lick adds to the stability. I now own 6 of these chairs, and no issues at all with any of them.
customer_reviews.author: Ian McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Great service!
customer_reviews.text: We love this chair! It is comfortable and the cup holders are big enough for large cups. Most importantly, the customer service is great. The plastic footing broke within a couple of months. I reached out to customer service who explained that they could not simply replace the plastic part. They sent me an entirely new chair! I asked if they wanted me to return the original one, which was still usable, and they told me to keep it. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Miller

customer_reviews.title: VERY comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I'd give these five stars on comfort alone (and they are COMFORTABLE), but I had to make a minor alteration to these (I have bought four over the years). The rivets that hold the cross pieces together are on a short life lease... They WILL pop off eventually making the chair unsafe. I replaced all with lock washers and a nylon lock not and now they are snug and secure. But man...these are seriously the most comfortable chair you can own at this price point. You don't sink way down in them so the support is awesome. Great chair!
customer_reviews.author: JD, Minnesota

customer_reviews.title: Comfy for All Heights and Ages, Handles Uneven Terrain Just Fine
customer_reviews.text: Took this camping and was very happy! Seats all sizes and heights of people... I, being 5'2", was just as comfortable as those in our group 6'+, and the kids could climb in and out easy as well. Cup holders are two different widths, they fit wine tumblers perfectly. Chair also handles uneven ground pretty well and is comfortable to strap on your back with or without the cover. It's a little awkward to walk around with it on your back if you're my height but manageable.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Ridge

customer_reviews.title: Quality control needs improving
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this chair for almost two years. It’s been on camping trips and to many soccer games. Besides that it sits in my car waiting to be used. My issue is that the bolt popped out about three months ago, and because of the positioning, I cannot get it back in. Without those, the chair can’t be used! They should’ve been tighter, so this didn’t happen. The other side is fine. Otherwise I love the chair. Just wish I could use it instead of sitting in the car during soccer practice!
customer_reviews.author: Rocket City Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great chair but sits higher than average
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, but only locks in the open position. I love that it has a carry strap on the actual chair frame, but because it does not lock in the closed position, the chair wants to unfold when you pick it up by the strap. It's a nice over-sized chair, but the seat is also very high off of the ground and cuts into the back of my legs making it uncomfortable when sitting for longer periods of time. I'm 5'6" so I would recommend this chair for very tall people.
customer_reviews.author: ShoppinMom

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever
customer_reviews.text: Love this chair! You can get in and out of it like a real chair, rather than the slump of a typical bag chair, and it has a strap to carry around without fitting it back in its bag! I've also tried the LX chair, and for some reason the front cross bars hit my thighs uncomfortably, but the L listed here is perfect. the fabric is stretched perfectly and firm. even my cat prefers it!
customer_reviews.author: Elixabeth

customer_reviews.title: Good but huge when folded
customer_reviews.text: This sturdy, comfortable camping chair comes at a cost - it is much longer and heavier than most other camping chairs. However, it is nice to have both small and large cup holders (large one can hold YETI Rambler insulated cup). Also, the crossbars on legs are connected with replaceable/repairable metal parts instead of the usual plastic foot+connector.
customer_reviews.author: Hax

customer_reviews.title: this one is juuuuuuust right
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these chairs. They are lightweight and come with a carrying handle which can be slung over the shoulder. We use them on the RV and they are just the right height for me (I'm 5'5" so I can sit around the campfire without my legs falling asleep or having the crawl out of it in an unlady-like fashion. Not shown in the photo is a handy little pocket for cell phone. The cupholders are a little lightweight, fine so far but not sure about their longevity, and the carrying bag isn't holding up well, but the chair itself is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Scubano

customer_reviews.title: They are very comfortable to sit on versus those worthless sling chairs
customer_reviews.text: The only draw back to the chair is when living at the beach sand and rust gets on the chair rail that makes the chair fold up. When that happins it sticks and you can not open it or close. I clean the area that the sand ruffed up and put oil on the rod. I will have to do that after each beach trip. I bought a pair for my daughter who live in the central valley of California and they have no complaints. They are very comfortable to sit on versus those worthless sling chairs . They are not that heavy besides the weight is what makes them sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: klinerdawg

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations
customer_reviews.text: We had tried several camp chairs that felt like you would collapse to the ground any second. These chairs are wonderful....sturdy.....19" seat height (for those of us of a certain age)...and very well made and comfortable. Easy to unfold/fold and replace in a sturdy carrying case with comfort strap. You feel like you're sitting in a real chair! They are a bit heavier than most folding chairs, so if weight is a problem you should take that into consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Goodeca

customer_reviews.title: Odor issue
customer_reviews.text: I didn't open this right away, and I regret it. This chair smells like pesticides. I bought one offline and liked it, and when i saw it on amazon I decided to get another one. The first one that I bought offline didn't smell like this. Really disappointed. I am right outside the return window. I'm going to try and air it out in the sun for a few days. But the smell is really strong and sickening. Maybe it was used.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: The BEST outdoor chairs Ive ordered!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best folding outdoor chair in terms of comfort. You will see reviews and videos about other outdoor camping chairs that are not comfortable when you sit because you sink into the chair and then you end up slouching in the chair. You cant sit for a while in these type of chairs. Kijaro solved this problem. The chair back and seat material are two pieces and the rear legs are slightly shorter than the front, so you get a great angled chair design and you can sit in these forever! Great job and these simple changes made huge improvements!
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Great product, worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are awesome. The quality is great. They are extremely comfortable. I am not a fan of sling back and low sitting chairs. We have these in both the rocker and the dual lock straight back. They are kind of heavy, but that's because they are a better quality chair. The price is kid of high in comparison to other camping chairs, but the higher price is for higher quality. The colors are vibrant and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair, great band
customer_reviews.text: L...O...V...E... THESE CHAIRS! Own two larger ones, but this slightly smaller one was mostly as nice. As a larger person (5'9" 200lbs) these are surprisingly sturdy and comfortable. I think this was about $40 and well worth it. The other two chairs we own from this company have lasted 6-7 years and are great. (That said, infrequent user.) Anyway would recommend this brand and these chairs. Will be my go-to for this kind of stuff. Thanks for the great products!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: The chairs are sturdy comfortable and worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I Bought Two colors of chair, but one was shipped on time and one got delayed. The chairs are made of a sturdy materials and is comfortable in seating. This chair is a little bit heavy than it's competitors but I believe that is because of good material used in making. I would recommend to buy these. They are a expensive than other chairs on amazon, but if you are looking for something to last longer, than this is a good bet.
customer_reviews.author: Manan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent chair!
customer_reviews.text: These chairs were purchased for my husband and I to sit in during hours of sports games and practice. These chairs are extremely sturdy, comfy, easy to fold/unfold and carry using the bag provided. The chair does lock when set for sitting and when folded. The chair strap is a tad awkward for me to use to transport the chair. Likely height issues. I am 5’4” and 118 lbs and am able to fold and carry them easily. The chairs support my husband who is 6’ 3” and 210lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Awesome chair. Best ever.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camp chairs. Super strong, comfortable and easy to fold/unfold. My favorite feature is the button release for folding unfolding. So it locks open and locks closed. The other nice thing is there isna shoulder straps on the chair itself. So you can fold it up (it locks closed) and carry it by the strap without having to deal with the bag. Love it. We're purchaed 5 total.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: These chairs are awesome. They're pretty big as camp chairs go and ...
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are awesome. They're pretty big as camp chairs go and very solidly built. Some other chairs have thin fabric and come apart where it meets the frame. These are not like that. The canvas is thick and secured really well. They will last a long time. They're pretty comfortable too. They lock when you fold them up to make it easier to get into the case. They also lock into the open position for when you're sitter by in them and release with a lever. They're not too heavy or large to carry around. I only with the cup holders were a little bigger to hold my camp mug, but a bottle or can still fits in them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This chair and I have a love/ hate relationship. Love how comfortable it is
customer_reviews.text: This chair and I have a love/ hate relationship. Love how comfortable it is, you're slightly reclined and not all scrunched up like normal portable chairs. After a couple of month, the bottom leg broke and lost it's screw. I'm not a large person at all. This is apparently a problem, because a friend of mine has the same chair and had the same problem. Of course, it's too late to return now.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 1 year of limited use
customer_reviews.text: Loved the comfort of this chair- much better than the cheap ones we would pick up at the grocery store. But those cheap ones have never broken on me! This chair had one of the brackets that holds the cross bars in the back completely snap when I was sitting on it. Now there is no stability to sit back in this chair- it is useless. It was not even used much, especially since spring soccer season was cancelled due to Corona virus. I'm very disappointed that it did not last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair, wrong color.
customer_reviews.text: I like the chair, it's comfortable, it's sturdy. They sent me wrong color but it's not worth trying to ship it back. Wish there wasn't a price difference in colors. I like that there's a strap on the carrying case and the chair itself. Will be very practical for the beach and camping. Been using it in my driveway, and impressed so far. Mesh back makes so you don't get sweaty, nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: K H

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor chair
customer_reviews.text: I got this chair as a gift for a friend. During the pandemic, we are meeting up for an outdoor picnic lunch, socially distancing, once a week. She now has a chair to bring to the gathering and she likes it.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. W.

customer_reviews.title: Great chair
customer_reviews.text: I go to my grand children's soccer games and this chair is very comfortable. This is my second chair as my bag ripped apart and then a screw came out. I paid to have the bag sewed but it didn't last long so after the screw came out, I decided it was time for a new chair. I had this same chair for at least 5 years so I thought it was time to get a new one - and yes bought the same kind as I like the seat and how it supports my back. I'll try to be more careful with my bag this time!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable camping chair I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I love this chair. It's so comfortable, has a place to put a drink, and comes in a bunch of cool colors. The only issue is that I have trouble getting it to click back into place when closed (so that means I HAVE to use the cover.) I was really hoping to stop using the cover, but such is life. Overall great chair for sitting around watching a kid's soccer game or telling stories around a fire.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Jeane

customer_reviews.title: Great chair, better then most.
customer_reviews.text: So many camping chairs out there. Cheap ones, garbage ones, sturdy etc etc. I thought I’d give this one a shot. I’m 240 pounds 6 ft tall. Man is this chair comfortable. Seems sturdy (time will tell) I will edit post if it breaks. My wife wanted it as soon as I opened it. So far , a great chair that’s larger than those cheap chairs, seems sturdy, and is comfortable. Recommended so far!
customer_reviews.author: Twilitegolf

customer_reviews.title: Great chair; sturdy, and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great, sturdy chair! All of my kids are in activities that require chairs along sidelines, so our chairs get a LOT of use. These chairs are slightly larger than the cheaper folding chairs you can get from a sporting good store, but weigh about the same. I especially like the larger cup holder in the arm that fits bigger hydroflasks and mobile phones. So far, we’re very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dahl

customer_reviews.title: Great Camp Chair for Tall People
customer_reviews.text: Love these chairs. They’re big, which is what I was looking for. They sit up high (I’m 6’2, 244lbs), are really comfortable, are sturdy. When folded, they are a big long, but that makes sense for their size. Came with cases and there’s a built in carry strap on the chair itself which is pretty cool. I’ve only used them a few times since I bought them so I can’t comment to the longevity of them. All in all, I’d definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: ZakkG’71

customer_reviews.title: Comfy chair - Check for irregular seems!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my husband one of these chairs a while back and never let him use it. So I finally purchased my own. they are very comfy and give a nice amount of straight support for the back and sturdy support for the seat. Unfortunately I've only had this chair for a bit and the seems on the back portion of the material have pulled out. It would appear as though they were not sewn to grasp enough fabric. Pretty disappointing...
customer_reviews.author: EHotchkiss

customer_reviews.title: Quality chair.... just wish it fit me.
customer_reviews.text: This chair is really comfortable. It gives you a lot of support and doesn't sink down which is important if you have back troubles. My only issue with this chair is that it is huge. It is also not very light. I will continue searching for a great chair for me, but this one was taken over by my husband. I am not very tall, coming in at only five foot one, and this one is a little bit too big for me. My feet do not comfortably come to the floor. I would love it if this chair came in a petite version that was a little bit smaller, and a little bit lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Meridsalk

customer_reviews.title: 2 pack perfect sized outdoor chairs!
customer_reviews.text: I love these chairs! they are a great size for everyone, and they have 2 cup holders per chair. They were so easy to take out of the box and unfold and put into place on my balcony, and at the time I had a broken shoulder in a sling! They are very comfortable and sturdy chairs. They hold up great being outside also, I live in Louisiana and it rains a lot and they have held up perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: HER

customer_reviews.title: Spacious seating made with quality material
customer_reviews.text: So much more spacious than your typical fold up, bag chair. I was in desperate need to replace my old sagging chairs. These are definitely luxury compared to what you would find at your big box store. Quality material, sturdy structure and spacious seating. Failed to mention you can actually get out the chair without grunting and groaning. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: SaraD

customer_reviews.title: They just feel better. We have chairs break on a regular basis
customer_reviews.text: We have regular campouts that we supply all the chairs around the fire. Many are Coleman and some are no brand. These chairs are the ones everyone grabs first! They are a bit larger and the seating is firmer, providing additional comfort and support. They just feel better. We have chairs break on a regular basis. After a year, these chairs are still going strong. The only thing to remember is to push the button when collapsing them. They DO NOT collapse without pushing it! The chairs are a bit pricey but they do go on sale. We are waiting for a sale again to get more. Eventually, all our chairs will be these!
customer_reviews.author: Nemoi

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied-bargain!
customer_reviews.text: This chair is large, wide, sturdy, heavy and an excellent value for camping, etc. The seat is very flat and taut, no sag when sitting in it. Locking seems to work well also. This is not a bright orange, natural color fits well in the desert. Score!
customer_reviews.author: oshkosh kid

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple of these to use on my condo balcony while I try to figure out a more permanent approach to furnishing that area. They are super-rigid and basically perfect, in my opinion. If you want a slouchy camp chair this might not be your bag. If you desire a supportive, roomy, folding chair that feels like it will last, then this is indeed your huckleberry.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Joints assembled with rivets fail quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Chairs are very comfortable. As many of the other one and two star reviews have stated, the joints that are secured with rivets pop loose after very little use. very disappointing for a chair that could have been very good.
customer_reviews.author: RSL

customer_reviews.title: Yay - no uncomfortable bar under my thighs!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a folding/portable chair to leave in the trunk of my car for my son's sporting events. I also wanted one that didn't have the uncomfortable bar that runs across the front of the chair and hits us short-legged uncomfortably under the thighs. This chair is perfect. It sits higher than other camping/portable chairs I've had before - more like a regular chair - which also makes it easier to get in and out of. Great for women and men alike and of all sizes and shapes. Great chair!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy chair with a high quality carrying bag!
customer_reviews.text: This chair is made very well. The turquoise color is beautiful. The additional locking feature is nice and it is very comfortable. I was very impressed with the quality of the carrying case as well since many are made of more flimsy material. The carrying bag is also slightly over-sized so you don't have such a tight squeeze in getting the chair packed up in the bag. The only change I'd like to see is the addition of a cooler like the Coleman has.
customer_reviews.author: CarolynN

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sports watching chair
customer_reviews.text: Slightly larger and heavier than many folding chairs, but still quite portable. Sturdy carrying case. Push button mechanism for opening and closing the chair works well but takes a little getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: BeeGee

customer_reviews.title: Great overall camp chair
customer_reviews.text: We've used the chairs only for a weeklong camping trip so far. The chairs are easy to set up and take down. They have a convenient carrying strap on them. They also have a carrying sack with a strap if you want to carry the chair that way. Very easy to transport and store. More importantly, they are comfortable. I enjoyed chilling out and reading and used the cup holders in the armrests for whatever I was needing to manage at the moment: waterbottle, toothbrush, smart phone, medication, sunscreen. Mesh back kept dampness at bay. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy and convenient
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of portable chair reviews before buying this one, and think it was a great deal for the price and quality. I'm 5'10" so wanted something that would be comfortable to sit in for over an hour and not too close to the ground with a high enough back. This chair is sturdy, easy to set up and collapse, and doesn't weigh too much (though I wouldn't want to walk more than 10 min with it probably). It's been great for reading outside and outdoor events, I've used it a ton since getting it at the start of summer. I got the dark green/turquoise color and love it. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Claire H

customer_reviews.title: Pro's and Con's
customer_reviews.text: The chair overall is pretty good after just a few use's except the "lock" the lock holds the chair in the closed position for moving around, and also locks in the open position both were features I wanted as my disabled wife would be using them, just after the 2nd/3rd use the locks failed and only work if you really mess with them .
customer_reviews.author: ravengar

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy large chair
customer_reviews.text: I always had an issue with the cheap camping chairs we bought, and hated how the bars dug into my thighs. The locking feature of this chair keeps the front flat and doesn't bow in so the bars are against your legs. It seems to be a high quality, and is pretty big.
customer_reviews.author: T H.

customer_reviews.title: BEST CHAIR EVER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: To all you moms, dads, friends and family members who sit on the sidelines and watch sports these are the best!!!! They are not like the sagging chair in the bag!! This has a firm seat on it and you don’t feel all hunched down. Love them!! Have bought more since this one!
customer_reviews.author: Raising Wild Ones

product_meta.title: Kijaro Dual Lock Portable Camping and Sports Chair
product_meta.description: When you have the Kijaro Dual Lock Chair in your car you have an easy-to-use seat for whatever the occasion: a soccer game, tailgating, watching fireworks – no matter what the outdoor event is, you're sure to have an awesome seat. You'll sit comfortably, too, since our portable ripstop polyester chair has a padded seat and headrest. Designed with a firm ''no sag'' seat. The dual lock technology makes sure the 300-pound capacity chair locks in the open position for maximum seat and back support. Our chair – available in a rainbow of colors – also features two mesh cup holders, a carry strap on the chair frame and a bag, mesh airflow on the back, and an organizer with a zip pocket, mesh pocket, and cell phone holder – all of which makes it a chair like no other. Open dimensions: 35.4L x 26W x 37.4H inches. Folded dimensions: 6.9L x 4.7W x 45.7H inches. From weekend soccer games to camping on the floor of the Grand Canyon, Kijaro offers quality products featuring innovative technology. Dual-lock chairs, modern accessories, and premium designs are offered in array of colors to match your personality. With a goal to provide relevance in a modern way, Kijaro builds products for today's journeys and for whatever you have in mind for tomorrow. Dual lock folding chair with carry strap and bag in a variety of colors. Firm no-sag seat. Locks open for stability. Locks closed for mobility. Organizer with zip pocket, mesh pocket, and cell phone holder. 2 mesh cup holders and cushion in headrest and seat. Made of 600 x 300d ripstop polyester. Height from ground to seat: 19 inches.
feature_bullets: -This portable Dual Lock chair gives you a premium seating experience with no-sag seating, durable diamond ripstop polyester, and breathable mesh on seat back
-The Dual Lock chair is perfect to take with you whether you are tailgating, camping, or watching your favorite sports teams
-Includes: 2 cup holders, organizer with zip & mesh pockets, carry strap attached to chair, and carry bag
-Supports up to 300 pounds. Product Weight- 9.4 pounds
-Locks open for extra stability/ Locks shut for easy transport

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
